title: Hero visual refinements + Secretary navigation hook registry

requirements.summary: Swap homepage hero background to the updated photorealistic collaboration/efficiency image and ensure the hero uses it responsively.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero background image is a photorealistic real-life scene representing community collaboration and efficiency
Hero section loads the updated image from the static assets directory under frontend/public/assets/generated
Image remains responsive (object-cover) across mobile/desktop without obvious cropping issues that hide key subjects

file_operations.description: Add the updated generated hero image asset (v2) to static assets so the homepage can load it from the generated assets directory.

Update the hero section to reference the new static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/whisper-hero-community-real-v2.dim_1600x900.png and adjust image presentation (e.g., object-position choices at breakpoints) to minimize subject-cropping while keeping object-cover responsiveness.

requirements.summary: Refine the hero overlay gradient/treatment to keep the photo recognizable while maintaining strong text readability across breakpoints.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero image details are visibly discernible behind the overlay on common viewport sizes
Hero headline and subtext remain clearly readable over the image
Overlay remains a gradient (not a flat color) and is applied consistently across breakpoints

file_operations.description: Tune the hero overlay gradient stops/opacities and (if needed) apply a subtle image treatment (e.g., brightness/contrast/saturation tweaks) so the photo remains recognizable while headline/subtext remain readable on mobile and desktop.

Add/adjust reusable utility styles for hero overlay/treatment (e.g., a dedicated hero overlay gradient utility and/or image treatment utility) to keep the overlay consistent across breakpoints and avoid one-off duplicated class strings.

requirements.summary: Improve hero headline pop, hero spacing/layout, and CTA button polish (hover/focus/shadows/borders) consistent with the current style system.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero headline has improved visual separation from background (e.g., tuned shadow/contrast) without reducing readability
Spacing between headline, description, and CTAs is visually balanced on mobile and desktop
Primary/secondary hero buttons have consistent hover/focus styling and feel cohesive with the rest of the page

file_operations.description: Refine hero typography/spacing (headline/subhead/CTA grouping) and standardize primary/secondary CTA styling (hover, focus-visible, shadow, border) to match existing tokens/utilities and improve cohesion across interactive elements.

Extend existing hero/button-related utilities (e.g., headline shadow tuning, glow/hover-lift, focus-visible ring helpers) to support the refined hero and CTA polish while staying consistent with the established style system.

requirements.summary: Refine Secretary widget readability/hierarchy: background/blur, user vs assistant bubble contrast, and typography hierarchy for header/quick actions/messages.
acceptanceCriteria: Secretary widget remains readable over both light and dark page areas
Assistant and user message bubbles have clearly distinguishable surfaces and consistent text contrast
Widget header, quick-actions label, and message text show clear hierarchy (size/weight/opacity)

file_operations.description: Adjust Secretary widget container backdrop (opacity/blur), refine message bubble surfaces for clearer assistant/user differentiation, and update typographic hierarchy (title, quick-actions label, message text) to improve readability and structure.

Update theme tokens/utilities that impact Secretary surfaces (e.g., secretary bubble color/contrast) and add any small supporting utilities needed for consistent widget readability across light/dark areas.

requirements.summary: Implement an extensible Secretary navigation/deep-link hook + registry so menu selections and basic free-text routing can direct users to pages/features or in-page sections, with a developer note for extending it.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a clear, documented pattern (hook + registry) that pages/features can use to register a navigable destination/action for the Secretary
Existing Secretary option selection can trigger navigation/directing behavior using the new hook system (at minimum, one or more current actions demonstrate the mechanism end-to-end)

The system supports both (a) opening/toggling in-page sections (e.g., reveal an existing section) and (b) URL-based deep links (e.g., via query/hash parameters) without requiring edits to immutable hook files
A short developer note is added describing how to register new destinations for future pages/features

file_operations.description: Create a Secretary navigation registry hook that lets features register destinations/actions (URL deep links and in-page section toggles) and exposes a stable API for the Secretary widget to invoke navigation without hardcoding per-feature logic in the widget.

Add shared types/helpers for Secretary navigation intents, deep-link serialization/parsing (query/hash), and a lightweight free-text matcher that can resolve user text to a registered destination/action.

Enhance free-text handling to attempt simple keyword-based routing into a navigation intent (or mapped option) before falling back to the menu prompt, enabling a basic end-to-end free-text directing flow.

Wire the widgetâ€™s option selection and free-text submit results into the new registry-driven navigation mechanism so choosing a quick action (and supported free-text) can trigger directing behavior.

Register current destinations (at minimum: proposals/issues browsing and one in-page toggle such as opening Create Instance) with the new registry; wire Secretary option selection to registry navigation; add section anchors/refs + optional scroll-into-view; and support URL-based deep links (query/hash) on load for direct navigation to registered destinations.

Add a short developer note documenting how to register new Secretary destinations/actions (registry pattern, deep-link IDs/params, and in-page toggle guidance) so future pages/features can extend navigation without touching immutable files.
